alert.note: Alert for Madison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following county, Madison. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Million, Newby, Crow Valley, Ruthton, Hillcrest, Cottonburg and Edenton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
